alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Yakutat (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 15 at 1:01PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following area, Northeast Gulf Coast. * WHEN...Until 100 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 PM AKDT, Satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain across the advisory area is occurring. Minor flooding is expected to begin late Saturday night, especially near the Situk River, Tawa Creek and the Lost River. Additional rainfall amounts up to 4 inches are possible through Sunday night in the Yakutat area. - Areas around 9 mile bridge, near Tawa Creek and the Lost River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - For Situk River near Yakutat: At 12:30pm the stage was 69.38 feet. Flood Stage is 71.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 71.75 feet is expected around 4:00am Sunday.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
